top_categories.workout_context: 56ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
Hibernator's Gravel roads, Northwoods terrain forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 62 miles.
At Hibernator, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Hibernator. Train it until it feels boring.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Hibernator's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before October.
Varied gradients on northwoods gravel roads demand climbing versatility. Sit the shallow stuff, stand the steep stuff, switch without thinking.
When someone attacks on northwoods gravel roads, you have 10 seconds to respond or you're off the back. This builds that response.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Hibernator, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
62 miles on northwoods gravel roads burns energy faster than the distance suggests. Train the fade resistance now.
Double-threshold training builds sustained power with less fatigue. More FTP per hour of training.
Low-cadence force work for 3,500ft of climbing. The slow, grinding ascents where you can't spin—you push.
Short, max efforts are unavoidable. Punchy climbs, gap closures, attacks on northwoods gravel roads. If you haven't trained them, you'll crack.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Hibernator’s 62 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Hibernator requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on northwoods gravel roads to build confidence. Expect: gravel roads, northwoods terrain, rolling hills.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on TT Threshold, Gravel Specific, and Over Under to prepare you for 62 miles of northwoods gravel roads in Laona, Wisconsin.
